sen.j: 重要文化財（じゅうようぶんかざい）とは日本に所在する建造物、美術工芸品等の有形文化財のうち、文化史的・学術的に特に重要なものとして文化財保護法に基づき日本国政府（文部科学大臣）が指定した文化財を指す。
sen.e: Important cultural properties are those tangible cultural heritages (such as constructions, buildings and the art craft articles) in Japan designated as cultural historically, or academically especially important under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties by the Japanese government (or the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology).

Important cultural properties are tangible cultural heritages (such as constructions, buildings and the art craft articles) in Japan that are designated as being culturally, historically or academically important under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties by the Japanese government (or the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology).

Important cultural properties are tangible cultural heritage (such as constructions, buildings and the art craft articles) in Japan that are designated as being culturally, historically or academically important under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties by the Japanese government (or the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology).

sen.j: 重文（じゅうぶん）と略称されることが多い。

National Institutes for Cultural Heritage refers these important cultural heritages as "Important Cultural Properties" in English.
National Institutes for Cultural Heritage refers to these important cultural heritages as "Important Cultural Properties" in English.

sen.j: 地方公共団体（都道府県、市町村）がそれぞれの文化財保護条例に基いて指定する有形文化財についても「県指定重要文化財」「市指定重要文化財」等と呼称される場合があるが、単に「重要文化財」という場合は通例国が指定した有形文化財のことを指す。
sen.e: While a local public entity (prefectural or municipal) may each refer a certain tangible property under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties as "Prefectural Designated Important cultural Property" or "Municipal Designated Important cultural Property", simply the term "Important cultural Property" refers in general that the tangible property is a national designated Important Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: 文化財保護条例→Ordinance for the Protection of Cultural Properties
sen.e: While a local public entity (prefectural or municipal) may refer to a certain tangible property under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties as a "prefectural designated important cultural property" or a "municipally designated important cultural property," the term "important cultural property" generally indicates that the tangible property is designated as a nationally important cultural property.

While a local public entity (prefectural or municipal) may refer to a certain tangible property under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties as a 'prefectural designated important cultural property' or a 'municipally designated important cultural property,' the term 'important cultural property' generally indicates that the tangible property is designated as a nationally important cultural property.

sen.j: 「文化財」とは、国や地方自治体の指定・選定・登録の有無に関わらず有形無形の文化的遺産全般を指す用語である。
sen.e: The term "Cultural Properties" refers to all those cultural heritages (regardless of whether or not they are tangible) in general as designated, selected, or registered by the nation or by a local government.
The term "cultural properties" refers to all those cultural heritages (regardless of whether or not they are tangible) as designated, selected or registered by the nation or by a local government.

The term "cultural properties" refers to all of those different cultural heritages (regardless of whether or not they are tangible) as designated, selected or registered by the nation or by a local government.
sen.cmt: “all those cultural heritages “→“all of those different cultural heritages “

sen.j: 文化財保護法では「文化財」を「有形文化財」「無形文化財」「民俗文化財」「記念物（史跡、名勝、天然記念物）」「文化的景観」「伝統的建造物群」の6つのカテゴリーに分類している（同法第2条第1項）が、このうちの「有形文化財」に該当するもので、国（文部科学大臣）によって指定されたものを「重要文化財」と呼称している（同法第27条第1項）。
sen.e: Under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties (Ordinance 2 Clause 1), "cultural properties" are classified into 6 categories; namely "tangible cultural properties," "intangible cultural properties," "folk cultural properties," "monuments (historic sites, places of scenic beauty, and natural monuments," "cultural scenery," and "classic architectures". Among these, those "tangible cultural properties" are designated by the nation (or the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) as "Important Cultural Properties " (under Ordinance 27 Clause 1 of the same law).
sen.cmt: 「無形文化財」→"intangible cultural properties"「民俗文化財」→"folk cultural properties"「記念物（史跡、名勝、天然記念物）」→"monuments (historic sites, places of scenic beauty, and natural monuments)"「文化的景観」→"cultural scenery"「伝統的建造物群」→"classic architectures"
sen.e: Under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties (Ordinance 2, Clause 1), "cultural properties" are classified into six categories: "tangible cultural properties," "intangible cultural properties," "folk cultural properties," "monuments (historical sites, places of scenic beauty and natural monuments," "cultural scenery" and "classic architecture"; among them, "tangible cultural properties" are designated by the nation (or the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) as "important cultural properties " (under Ordinance 27, Clause 1 of the same law).

Under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties (Ordinance 2, Clause 1), 'cultural properties' are classified into six categories: 'tangible cultural properties,' 'intangible cultural properties,' 'folk cultural properties,' 'monuments (historical sites, places of scenic beauty and natural monuments,' 'cultural scenery' and 'classic architecture'; among them, 'tangible cultural properties' are designated by the nation (or the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) as 'important cultural properties' (under Ordinance 27, Clause 1 of the same law).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。

sen.j: 上述のように、法令・行政用語としての「重要文化財」は国の指定を受けた文化財全般を指す用語ではない。
sen.e: As described above, "Important Cultural Properties" as a legal and administrative term does not refer to all the national designated cultural properties in general. Rather, the term refers only to those national designated tangible cultural properties. Please be aware of the point.

As described above, "important cultural properties" as a legal and administrative term is not a general reference to all nationally designated cultural properties. Instead, the term refers only to nationally designated tangible cultural properties, so please be aware of this point.

sen.e: Similar terms such as "important intangible cultural properties," "important tangible folk cultural properties," and "important intangible folk cultural properties" are not to be confused with "important cultural properties". They belong to different categories. For example, it is inappropriate to abbreviate "important tangible folk cultural properties " as "important cultural properties".

Similar terms such as "important intangible cultural properties," "important tangible folk cultural properties" and "important intangible folk cultural properties" should not be confused with "important cultural properties," since they belong to different categories; for example, it's inappropriate to abbreviate "important tangible folk cultural properties" as "important cultural properties."

Similar terms such as 'important intangible cultural properties,' 'important tangible folk cultural properties' and 'important intangible folk cultural properties' should not be confused with 'important cultural properties,' since they belong to different categories; for example, it's inappropriate to abbreviate 'important tangible folk cultural properties' as 'important cultural properties.'

sen.j: 重要文化財のうち製作が特に優れたもの、歴史上特に意義の深いものなど学術的に価値の特に高いものが国宝に指定される。
sen.e: Among the Important Cultural Properties, those made with extraordinary supreme craftsmanship, or those precious items with especially high academic value such as historical significance are designated as "national treasures".

Among the important cultural properties, those made with extraordinarily superb craftsmanship, or precious items with particularly high academic value such as historical significance, are designated as national treasures.

Among the important cultural properties, those made with extraordinarily superb craftsmanship, or precious items with particularly high academic value such as historical significance, are designated as national treasures.

sen.e: Therefore, under the law, "National Treasures" is a subgroup under "Important Cultural Property."
Therefore, under the law, the classification "national treasure" is a subgroup of the category "Important Cultural Property."

sen.cmt: 慣用句。 “under the law” => “in law”括弧必要。 => “ 'National Treasure' と '' 'Important Cultural property'. ” 括弧に関しては全体を通して統一する必要あり。

sen.j: なお、1950年（昭和25年）の文化財保護法施行以前の旧制度下では、現在の「重要文化財」に相当するものがすべて「国宝」と称されていたので混同しないよう注意を要する。
sen.e: However, under the old system before the enforcement of Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties in 1950, all the present "important cultural properties" were called "national treasures". Please note this and do not get confused.

However, under the system that existed prior to the enforcement of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, which occurred in 1950, all of what are now designated as important cultural properties were called national treasures, so this point should be noted in order to avoid confusion.

However, under the system that existed prior to the enforcement of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, which occurred in 1950, all of what are now designated as important cultural properties were called national treasures, so this point should be noted in order to avoid confusion.

sen.j: 文化財保護法の規定により、地方公共団体（都道府県・市町村）は国指定の文化財以外の文化財について「当該地方公共団体の区域内に存するもののうち重要なものを指定して、その保存及び活用のため必要な措置を講ずることができる」とされている（同法第182条第2項）。
sen.e: Under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties (Ordinance 182 Clause 2), a local public entity (prefectural or municipal) may also designate its certain heritages (other than those national designated cultural properties) in its territory as important properties, and choose the measures necessary for their preservation or for their proper use.

Under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties (Ordinance 182, Clause 2), a local public entity (prefectural or municipal) may also designate certain heritages (other than nationally designated cultural properties) within its territory as important properties, and may choose the measures necessary for their preservation or their proper use.

Under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties (Ordinance 182, Clause 2), a local public entity (prefectural or municipal) may also designate certain heritage (other than nationally designated cultural properties) within its territory as important properties, and may choose the measures necessary for their preservation or their proper use.

sen.j: これに基づき各都道府県・市町村ではそれぞれ文化財保護条例を定め、有形・無形の文化財の指定を行っている。
sen.e: Based on this, each prefecture or municipality may legislate its own ordinances for the protection of cultural properties, and designate its own tangible or intangible cultural properties.
Accordingly, each prefecture or municipality may legislate its own ordinances for the protection of cultural properties and may designate its own tangible or intangible cultural properties.
Accordingly, each prefecture or municipality may legislate its own ordinances for the protection of cultural properties and may designate its own tangible or intangible cultural properties.

sen.e: These cultural properties are written as, "OO prefectural designated cultural property" or "OO municipal designated cultural property," in order to be distinguished from the national designated cultural properties.

These cultural properties are written as "OO prefectural designated cultural property" or "OO municipal designated cultural property" so as to distinguish them from the nationally designated cultural properties.

sen.j: 都道府県・市町村指定の有形文化財については「東京都指定有形文化財」のように「有形文化財」と呼称するケースが多いが、同様の文化財を青森県では「青森県重宝」、長野県では「長野県宝」、鳥取県では「鳥取県指定保護文化財」と呼称するなど一定しておらず、どのように呼称するかは各自治体の文化財保護条例で個々に規定している。
sen.e: Concerning the prefectural or municipal designated tangible cultural properties, there are many cases classified as and named with the suffix "tangible cultural properties "such as "Tokyo municipal designated Tangible cultural properties". For the same kind of cultural properties, they may be classified as "Aomori prefectural treasures" in Aomori Prefecture, "Nagano prefectural treasures" in Nagano Prefecture, or "Tottori prefectural designated cultural properties" in Tottori Prefecture. There is no preset rule and each prefecture or municipality may individually name them in accordance with their ordinances for the protection of cultural properties.

Regarding the prefectural or municipally designated tangible cultural properties, many cases are classified as and named with the suffix "tangible cultural properties," such as "Tokyo municipally designated tangible cultural properties," but the same kinds of cultural properties may be classified as "Aomori prefectural treasures" in Aomori Prefecture, "Nagano prefectural treasures" in Nagano Prefecture or "Tottori prefectural designated cultural properties" in Tottori Prefecture; however, there is no preset rule, so each prefecture or municipality may individually name them in accordance with its ordinances for the protection of cultural properties.

Regarding the prefectural or municipally designated tangible cultural properties, many cases are classified as and named with the suffix 'tangible cultural properties,' such as 'Tokyo municipally designated tangible cultural properties,' but the same kinds of cultural properties may be classified as 'Aomori prefectural treasures' in Aomori Prefecture, 'Nagano prefectural treasures' in Nagano Prefecture or 'Tottori prefectural designated cultural properties' in Tottori Prefecture; however, there is no preset rule, so each prefecture or municipality may individually name them in accordance with its ordinances for the protection of cultural properties.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。

sen.e: Among the 47 prefectures and municipalities, Fukushima, Gunma, Kanagawa, Gifu, Okayama, Hiroshima, and Saga designate, based on their prefecture or municipal ordinances, some selected tangible cultural properties as "OOprefectural/municipal important cultural properties". Please be aware not to confuse these with the national designated important cultural properties.

sen.j: 日本における最初の文化財関連法令と見なされるのは1871年（明治4年）の太政官布告「古器旧物保存方」（こききゅうぶつほぞんかた）である。
sen.e: In Japan, the earliest ordinance concerning cultural properties is the "Edict of Preserving Antiques and Old Items" announced by the early Meiji government in 1871.
In Japan, the earliest ordinance concerning cultural properties is the "Edict for the Preservation of Antiquities and Old Items," which was announced by the early Meiji government in 1871.
In Japan, the earliest ordinance concerning cultural properties is the 'Edict for the Preservation of Antiquities and Old Items,' which was announced by the early Meiji government in 1871.

sen.j: この布告に基づいて近畿地方を中心とした社寺等に提出させた「古器旧物」の目録を元に、翌1872年（明治5年）5月から10月にかけて日本初の文化財調査とされる壬申検査が実施された。
sen.e: Based on this Edict, and a checklist of "Antiques and Old Items " submitted to the temples and shrines mainly in the Kinki region, "Jinshin Kensa," the first investigation on cultural properties in Japan, was conducted from May through October of 1872 (one year after the Edict).

Based on the edict and a checklist of "antiques and old items " submitted to temples and shrines mainly in the Kinki region, "Jinshin Kensa," the first investigation of cultural properties in Japan, was conducted from May through October of 1872 (a year after the edict).

Based on the edict and a checklist of 'antiques and old items' submitted to temples and shrines mainly in the Kinki region, Jinshin Kensa, the first investigation of cultural properties in Japan, was conducted from May through October of 1872 (a year after the edict).

sen.j: ちなみに「壬申」は1872年（明治5年）の干支であり、「検査」は現代日本語の「調査」に相当する。
sen.e: By the way, "Jinshin" is the zodiac sign for the year 1872, and "Kensa" means "investigation" in modern Japanese language.
Incidentally, "Jinshin" is the astrological term for the year 1872, and "kensa" means "investigation" in the modern Japanese language.

sen.e: During this Jinshin Inspection, besides the officials from the Education Ministry such as Hisanari MACHIDA (first director of Tokyo National Museum) and Noritane NINAGAWA, there were Yuichi TAKAHASHI (a painter) and Matsusaburo YOKOYAMA (a photographer) accompanying the team as recorders.

sen.j: 文化財保護法は「重要文化財につき、所有者が判明しない場合又は所有者若しくは管理責任者による管理が著しく困難若しくは不適当であると明らかに認められる場合には、文化庁長官は、適当な地方公共団体その他の法人を指定して、当該重要文化財の保有のため必要な管理（中略）を行わせることができる」と規定している（同法第32条の2）。
sen.e: In accordance with the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, Ordinance 32 Clause 2 says "If the owner of an important cultural property is unclear, or if it is obviously admitted that the management by the owner or the management representative is remarkably difficult or improper, then the chief officer of Agency for Cultural Affairs may assign a suitable local public entity or other corporation to do the necessary management (…details omitted…) in order to protect the important cultural property concerned."

sen.j: 文化財保護法第29条には「国宝又は重要文化財が国宝又は重要文化財としての価値を失つた場合その他特殊の事由があるときは、文部科学大臣は、国宝又は重要文化財の指定を解除することができる」との規定がある。
sen.e: The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties Ordinance 29 stipulates that, " When a national treasure or an important cultural property has lost its value as a national treasure or an important cultural property, or else under special circumstance, the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology can cancel the designation as a national treasure or an important cultural property.

The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, Ordinance 29, stipulates, "When a national treasure or an important cultural property has lost its value as a national treasure or an important cultural property, setting aside special circumstances, the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology may cancel its designation as a national treasure or an important cultural property.

The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, Ordinance 29, stipulates, 'When a national treasure or an important cultural property has lost its value as a national treasure or an important cultural property, the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology may, given these special circumstances, cancel its designation as a national treasure or an important cultural property.'

sen.j: また2006年（平成18年）、原爆犠牲者を弔い世界平和を祈念するための教会堂世界平和記念聖堂（村野藤吾設計、1954年（昭和29年）8月竣工）と広島平和記念公園の中心施設広島平和記念資料館（丹下健三設計、1955年（昭和30年）8月開館）が、戦後建築としては初めての重要文化財指定となった。
sen.e: Moreover in 2006, the church Memorial Cathedral for World Peace (designed by Togo MURANO, completion in August 1954), which is for holding funeral for the atomic bomb victims and praying for global peace, and Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum (designed by Kenzo TANGE, opened in August 1955), which is a central facility in Hiroshima Peace Park, were the first postwar buildings designated as "important cultural properties".

Moreover, in 2006 the Memorial Cathedral for World Peace (designed by Togo MURANO, completed in August 1954), which is for holding funerals for victims of the atomic bomb and praying for global peace, and the Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum (designed by Kenzo TANGE and opened in August 1955), which is a central facility in Hiroshima Peace Park, were the first postwar buildings designated as important cultural properties.

sen.j: 高度経済成長による日本人の生活様式の変化に伴い、伝統的な民家が急速に姿を消し始めた1960年代から民家の重要文化財指定が積極的に推進されるようになった。
sen.e: With high economic growth, lifestyle of Japanese has been changing. When traditional private houses began to disappear rapidly in the 1960's, designation of private houses as "important cultural properties" were accelerated.

sen.j: なお、第二次大戦終戦以前に国の指定を受けていた民家は大阪府羽曳野市の吉村家住宅（1937年（昭和12年）指定）と京都市の小川家住宅（通称「二条陣屋」、1944年（昭和19年）指定）のわずか2件のみであった。
sen.e: The private houses which received national designation before the end of World War II were only 2 cases; namely the Yoshimura Residence (designated in 1937) in Habikino City of Osaka Prefecture, and the Ogawa Residence (aka. "Nijo-jin'ya," designated in 1944) in Kyoto City.

With the 1975 revision of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, the category entitled 'Historical Resources Section' was established.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。

sen.j: 「歴史資料の部」の重要文化財新規指定は1977年（昭和52年）に初めて行われ、この時は「長崎奉行所キリシタン関係資料」（東京国立博物館）と「春日版板木」（奈良市・興福寺）の2件が指定された。
sen.e: The first "historical resource" designated as "important cultural property was done in 1977. At the time, 2 cases were designated, namely "Christian materials of Nagasaki Magistrate Office"(Tokyo National Museum) and "printing block of Kasuga Print" (Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara City).

The first designation of an historical resource designated as an important cultural property occurred in 1977; at that time two cases were designated, namely "Christian materials of the Nagasaki Magistrate Office"(Tokyo National Museum) and "Printing block of a Kasuga print" (Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara City).

The first designation of an historical resource designated as an important cultural property occurred in 1977; at that time two cases were designated, namely 'Christian materials of the Nagasaki Magistrate Office' (Tokyo National Museum) and 'Printing block of a Kasuga print' (Kofuku-ji Temple, Nara City).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。スペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: なお、従来「絵画」「書跡・典籍」等として重要文化財に指定されていた物件で「歴史資料の部」に移されたものもある。
sen.e: Moreover, there were also some designated "important cultural properties" originally belonging to "paintings" or "calligraphies and books" but got transferred to "historical resources".

Additionally, there were some designated important cultural properties that were originally classified as paintings or calligraphies and books but were moved to the historical resources classification.

Additionally, there were some designated important cultural properties that were originally classified as paintings or calligraphies and books but were moved to the historical resources classification.

sen.j: 一例として、仙台市博物館保管の「慶長遣欧使節関係資料」は1966年（昭和41年）に「絵画の部」の重要文化財に指定されていたが上述の文化財保護法改正に伴って「歴史資料の部」に移され、2001年（平成13年）に歴史資料としては最初の国宝指定を受けている。
sen.e: As one example, "materials related to the mission to Europe in the Keicho era " kept at Sendai City Museum was designated as "important cultural property " in the "paintings" section in 1966. However, with the above-mentioned revision of the Law of the Protection for Cultural Properties, it is moved to "historical resources" section. In 2001, it became the first "historical resource" designated as "national treasure".
sen.cmt: 仙台市博物館保管→kept at Sendai City Museum「慶長遣欧使節関係資料」→"materials related to the mission to Europe in the Keicho era "
sen.e: As one example, "materials related to the mission to Europe in the Keicho era," kept at the Sendai City Museum, was designated as an important cultural property in the paintings section in 1966, but with the above-mentioned revision of the Law for the Protection for Cultural Properties it was moved to the historical resources section; in 2001, it became the first historical resource to be designated as a national treasure.

As one example, 'materials related to the mission to Europe in the Keicho era,' kept at the Sendai City Museum, was designated as an important cultural property in the paintings section in 1966, but with the above-mentioned revision of the Law for the Protection for Cultural Properties it was moved to the historical resources section; in 2001, it became the first historical resource to be designated as a national treasure.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。

sen.j: 歴史資料として指定を受けているものには政治家、学者などの歴史上の人物に関する一括資料、古写真やその原板、古地図、古活字、科学技術関係資料、産業関係資料などさまざまなものがある。
sen.e: The "historical resources" designated so far are much diversified in types. They may be batch materials concerning a politician, a scholar, or some person in the history, old photographs and their negative plates, old maps, old printing types, materials related to science and technology, or materials related to industry.

The historical resources thus far designated cover a wide range of types: they may be batch materials concerning a politician, a scholar or some person in history, old photographs and their negative plates, old maps, old printing type, materials related to science and technology or materials related to industry.

The historical resources thus far designated cover a wide range of types: they may be a batch of materials concerning a politician, a scholar or some person in history, old photographs and their negative plates, old maps, old printing type, materials related to science and technology or materials related to industry.

sen.j: 人物関係資料としては高野長英、間宮林蔵、坂本龍馬、大久保利通、岩倉具視などの一括資料がある。
sen.e: Batch materials related to a person included the following people: Choei TAKANO, Rinzo MAMIYA, Ryoma SAKAMOTO, Toshimichi OKUBO, and Tomomi IWAKURA.
Batch materials thus designated have been in reference to the following people: Choei TAKANO, Rinzo MAMIYA, Ryoma SAKAMOTO, Toshimichi OKUBO and Tomomi IWAKURA.
Batches of materials thus designated have been in reference to the following people: Choei TAKANO, Rinzo MAMIYA, Ryoma SAKAMOTO, Toshimichi OKUBO and Tomomi IWAKURA.

sen.j: 科学技術関係では平賀源内のエレキテル、初期の天体望遠鏡、天球儀、モールス電信機などがある。
sen.e: For "historic resources" related to science and technology, there are electrics of Gennai HIRAGA, an early astronomical telescope, a celestial globe, and a Morse telegraphic instrument, etc.
For historical resources related to science and technology, there are the electrical works of Gennai HIRAGA, an early astronomical telescope, a celestial globe, a Morse telegraphic instrument, etc.
For historical resources related to science and technology, there are the electrical works of Gennai HIRAGA, an early astronomical telescope, a celestial globe, a Morse telegraphic instrument, etc.

sen.j: 産業関係では初期の印刷機、製紡機、鉄道車両などがある。
sen.e: For "historic resources" related to industry, there are an initial printer, spinning machine, railway carriage, etc.
The historical resources related to industry include an early printing press, spinning machine, railway carriage, etc.
The historical resources related to industry include an early printing press, spinning machine, railway carriage, etc.

sen.j: 明治時代以降の日本の近代化に寄与してきた産業・交通・土木関連の建造物である。
sen.e: These are construction heritages related to industries, traffic, and civil engineering works attributed to the modernization of Japan since Meiji Period. In more concrete terms, they include collieries, power plants, dams, watersheds, canals, railway installations, and port installations, etc. and became receiving attention as a new genre of the cultural property at about the end of the 20th century.

These are construction heritages related to industrial, traffic and civil engineering works attributed to the modernization of Japan since the Meiji period. In more concrete terms, they include collieries, power plants, dams, watersheds, canals, railway installations, port installations, etc., and since the end of the twentieth century they've received attention as a new genre of cultural properties.
These are construction heritages related to industrial, traffic and civil engineering works attributed to the modernization of Japan since the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 具体的には炭鉱、発電所、ダム、水源地、運河、鉄道施設、港湾施設などが、20世紀末頃から文化財の新たなジャンルとして着目されるようになった。
sen.e: In more concrete terms, they include collieries, power plants, dams, watersheds, canals, railway installations, port installations, etc., and since the end of the twentieth century they've received attention as a new genre of cultural properties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: これらを包括的に「近代化遺産」と称し、1993年（平成5年）から「建造物の部」の重要文化財の指定対象となっている。
sen.e: These are collectively called "modernization heritages". Since 1993(1993), they have become designation candidates as "important cultural properties" in the "buildings" section.
These are collectively called "modernization heritages"; since 1993 they have become candidates for designation as important cultural properties in the "buildings" section.
These are collectively called 'modernization heritage'; since 1993 they have become candidates for designation as important cultural properties in the 'buildings' section.
sen.cmt: 文法。 “heritages” は単数扱いであるべき。→”heritage”

sen.j: ちなみに、1993年（平成5年）度に指定されたのは秋田市の「藤倉水源地水道施設」と群馬県の「碓氷峠鉄道施設」の2件であった。
sen.e: By the way, designated in 1993 were only 2 cases: "Water supply installations of Fujikura watershed" of Akita City, and "Railway installations of the Usui Pass" of Gunma Prefecture.
Incidentally, only two cases were designated in 1993: "Water supply installations of the Fujikura watershed" in Akita City, and "Railway installations of the Usui Pass" in Gunma Prefecture.
Incidentally, two cases were designated in 1993: 'Water supply installations of the Fujikura watershed' in Akita City, and 'Railway installations of the Usui Pass' in Gunma Prefecture.
sen.cmt: only を削除しました。原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。

sen.j: 「藤倉水源地水道施設」についてはダム、貯水池、沈殿池などの施設と土地が、「碓氷峠鉄道施設」については連続する橋梁やトンネルに加え発電所などの付属施設と土地が併せて指定されており、単体の建造物としての橋梁やトンネルではなくシステム全体が保存の対象となっている。
sen.e: For the "Water supply installations of Fujikura watershed," it includes the land and the facilities such as the dam, the reservoir, and the settling reservoir. For the "Railway installations of the Usui Pass," in addition to the connecting bridge and the tunnel, the entire system including the land and the attached facilities such as the power plant was designated as the object of preservation.

The designation regarding "water-supply installations of the Fujikura watershed" includes the land and facilities such as the dam, reservoir and settling pond; as for the designation of "railway installations of the Usui Pass," in addition to the connecting bridge and the tunnel, the entire system--including the land and the attached facilities such as the power plant--was designated as the object of preservation.

The designation regarding 'water supply installations of the Fujikura watershed' includes the land and facilities such as the dam, reservoir and settling pond; as for the designation of 'railway installations of the Usui Pass,' in addition to the connecting bridge and the tunnel, the entire system--including the land and the attached facilities such as the power plant--was designated as the object of preservation.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ、"を'にしました。water-supply→water supply に変更しました。
